item.title: What is needed to use Tuttle?
item.description: 1. Access to a repository To use Tuttle access to a repository on Github or Gitlab is necessary. This can be public or private repositories. On-premise servers will of course also work. 2. Tuttle application You can install the Tuttle application from the eXist-db public repository by using the eXist-db Dashboard. 3. Access token In order to authenticate to the VCS (version control system) and being allowed to access its API a ‘personal access token’ is needed.

item.title: Which Git providers are supported?
item.description: Tuttle supports either Github and Gitlab repositories.

item.title: How to configure Tuttle?
item.description: Tuttle is configured in modules/config.xqm in your Tuttle installation. You may use eXide to edit the config.xqm. Below is an example configuration that shows an example for either Github and Gitlab. Due to the different API of these services the configuration differs sligtly. See parameter description below. item.title: Can i have multiple repositories?
item.description: Yes. It’s possible to configure multiple repositories even of different types. So for instance you can have one Gitlab repository connected to one target collection in the database and another collection that is bound to a Github repository somewhere else. Each configuration item will correspond to exactly one target collection. However target collections must not be nested as that would cause trouble.
